intro: Trichocline nivea, commonly known as the snow trichocline, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered together, giving it a fluffy appearance. Trichocline nivea is adapted to cold, mountainous environments and thrives in well-drained soils. Its foliage is typically covered in fine, hair-like structures, which help to insulate the plant against harsh weather conditions.
